author: Staff Reporter
text:
Over 2,340 government employees, including women, courted arrest after attempting to stage demonstration near Anna statue at the central bus stand in Krishnagiri on Monday as part of the on-going strike by the Tamil Nadu Government Employees’ Federation to press for the charter of demands.

The employees from various departments were demanding withdrawal of the new pension scheme and filing up of vacancies. Their other demands included revision of allowances on par with Central government employees, dearness benefits; additional allowances for government employees overburdened with additional work due to non-filling of vacancies in the government departments.

The protesters also demanded that the government do away with ad-hoc appointments through contracts, daily wage, and outsourcing arrangements and regularise recruitments through public service commission and employment exchanges; the dissolved administrative tribunal for redress should be reconstituted; increase the family protection fund to Rs.10 lakh; and outdated caveats in the government employees code of conduct should be done away with.

The Association of government employees also called for providing employment on compassionate grounds to the wards of deceased road workers.

The other demands included reinstatement of Makkal Nala Paniyalargal in the State; recognise employees of corporations, municipality, and town Panchayats as government employees and provide for payment through treasury; government should take over medical insurance scheme. The arrested included 1,826 women and 522 men in Krishnagiri district.

In Dharmapuri, 1,123 employees courted arrest.
title: Govt. staff stage agitation, court arrest
